list.text:
String and Brass Tacks
Raid your cabinets and drawers to dress up plain Styrofoam balls. Kitchen twine looks rather rustic, and studded tacks add a glam serious factor.

Embroidery Hoops
A lattice design looks pretty on a holiday pie and on a mini ornament. Plus, you can pick ribbons to match your tree's color scheme.

Golden Cornucopias
Paper cones filled with candy work as ornaments now and party favors later. Try wrapped peppermints, chocolate kisses or truffles for more color than mess.

Origami Bird
Adopt a white Christmas theme and keep things monochrome. The details on these folded doves pop even more in a neutral hue.

Glittery Lights
While trees these days use LEDs, don't give up on old-fashioned lights just yet. A coat of glitter means these bulbs will never burn out.

Favorite Memories
Look back on the year's best moments with homemade photo ornaments. They'll cover a tabletop tree in no time; just print, mount and glue on ribbon. Get ready for the nostalgia.

Scandinavian Inspiration
Red, white and wheat decorations take a page from Nordic style. Fold wheat stalks to make the star ornament and use a stencil to cut out a cute caribou.

Molded Birdseed
Don't forget the trees outside. A frozen treat attracts blue jays and goldfinches even in the wintertime, but the cookie-cutter shape looks at home indoors too.

Butter Cookies
Skip rolling and cutting dough and string up store-bought treats instead. Choose varieties with a center hole and hang out of pets' (and kids') reach. ($4, amazon.com)

Santa's Hat
Even the laziest crafter can stick letters on generic ornaments. ($4, amazon.com) Spell out joy, peace or other short words to use up the rest of the alphabet. And don't forget a red felt hat as a tribute to Saint Nick.

Serious Bling
Self-adhesives come in handy yet again. Dot colored balls with sticky-backed jewels for a little extra sparkle.

Paint-by-Numbers
Get homemade tree trimmers courtesy of a kid's craft project. Follow the instructions and then cut out the silhouettes using heavy-duty scissors.
